VLIB_conv_i16s_c16s_o32s_5x5_skip2_tile

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_conv_i16s_c16s_o32s_5x5_skip2_tile (const sBuffer_t *pInChannel, const sBuffer_t *pWeights, const sBuffer_t *pBias, const sBuffer_t *pOutChannel, uint32_t shiftQ, uint32_t coeffQ)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_conv_i16s_c16s_o32s_5x5_skip2_tile ( const sBuffer_t *  pInChannel,
const sBuffer_t *  pWeights,
const sBuffer_t *  pBias,
const sBuffer_t *  pOutChannel,
uint32_t  shiftQ,
uint32_t  coeffQ 
)

Description:
Performs 5x5 convolution of N 16-bit inputs with N x M 16-bit weights producing M 32-bit outputs.
Each W x H 16-bit inputs, skipped in alternate horizontal and vertical pixels, are convolved with corresponding K x K 16bit weights and accumulated N times to produce one (((W - K) + 1)/ 2) x (((H - K) + 1)/2) 32-bit output. This output is then rounded and shifted down to a 32-bit range prior to storing in the output array. This process is repeated for M outputs.
Parameters:
[in] *pInChannel Pointer to N 16-bit input channels
[in] *pWeights Pointer to N x M 16-bit weights
[in] *pBias Pointer to M 16-bit bias values
[out] *pOutChannel Pointer to M 32-bit ouput channels
[in] *shiftQ Shift factor to adjust output range
[in] *coeffQ Shift factor to adjust coefficient range
Assumptions:
  • Input, output, weights, bias buffer address is aligned to 8-bytes
  • Pitch of input, output, weights must be multiple of 8
  • Weights value must be zero padded. A 5x5 kernel must be stored as 8x5 matrix with last 3 columns zeroed out. Eg: 1 1 1 1 1 0 0 0 2 2 2 2 2 0 0 0 3 3 3 3 3 0 0 0 4 4 4 4 4 0 0 0 5 5 5 5 5 0 0 0
Implementation Notes:
The code is interruptible.
This code is compatible with C66x processors.
